ratings.comment: Annika is a great teacher, she clearly cares about her students, and goes up to bat for them. She is incredibly understanding, and if you have any issues with deadlines or assignments, all you need to do is meet with her. She keeps her lessons interesting with games and activities. If you take a Spanish class, make sure it is with Annika.

I originally thought I was going to have a personality clash with Annika, but she ended up being really understanding with personal circumstances. May be too strict/intense sometimes, but she really does care about you and wants you to succeed in this class.

She is an amazing professor who clearly wants her students to succeed in the class. She is always available to offer additional help to her students if needed. She also ensures that the classroom environment is accepting, friendly, and fun. I'm very thankful I had her as my professor, as I feel like I received an extremely thorough education.
Cares deeply about her students and wants everyone to reach their full potential.

Assignments can be tough, but requirements are outlined clearly; big assignments can have revisions for points back! Took it as an 8:50 class, but she keeps you engaged with content (games/class collab), making it less brutal of a morning, but attendance and the book are required, very manageable class if you put in the effort

3-4 assignments daily and sometimes in the book, you have to buy a textbook, assignments aren't bad and you're able to do them ahead of time. She's really dedicated and is a nice professor. Make sure to email her about anything and if you miss a test, email her quickly otherwise it'll be a 0. Put your effort in and you'll do great in this class.
She is very passionate about her job!
